page.title: 19Interesting Scenery,Building
page.content: In Burley most of the landscape is heathland. Then it is forest and last of all residential. The trees in the forest are conifers,ash,beech,oak and fir.Historically one of the most interesting buildings in Burley is the Burley Manor which is a hotel.It has got a swimming pool round the back.The Manor has recently been built because it was burnt down in 1936.It was first built in 1251.In the Victorian times the Queen's Head pub and inn was built,with a smithy on the east end.In 1900 the inn was altered and the smithy moved to the west end. The Burley Grange is owned by the Butchers.The Grange has a lot of acres and they also have a tennis court.Next to the Grange there is a cottage called the Burley Grange cottage.There is an old well called Ladywell at Burley Street.
